Accessibility Audit Pro

- Single-file Python 3 script using only standard library (os, sys, json, pathlib, argparse, curses, re)
- Command-line app for auditing website accessibility via HTML file analysis
- Save/load audit reports to JSON file in user-specified directory (default: ./audits/)
- Core features:
  * Parse HTML files for missing alt attributes on images (regex: img[^>]*src)
  * Detect missing lang attributes on html tag
  * Flag headings not in sequential order (h1-h6)
  * Check for empty links (a tags with no text content)
  * Count ARIA roles vs missing ARIA labels
  * Report color contrast issues via inline style RGB parsing
- Curses-based TUI with keyboard navigation:
  * Arrow keys: navigate audit results list
  * Enter: expand/collapse file details
  * 'a': run audit on new directory
  * 'l': load saved audit
  * 's': save current audit
  * 'p': toggle print-friendly summary view
  * 'q': quit
  * Tab: switch between file list and issues panel
- Responsive grid layout in curses (60x20 min size, auto-scale columns)
- Persistence: autosave last 10 audits to audits.json with timestamps
- Print-friendly mode: generate terminal-optimized report with fixed-width columns for easy copy-paste
- Accessibility of app itself: full keyboard-only operation, screen-reader friendly status line, high-contrast curses colors
- Command-line args: python audit.py /path/to/html/dir --output ./reports
- Testable features:
  * Create test.html with broken images/missing lang, verify audit flags 3 issues
  * Run audit on sample dir with 5 files, save/load JSON, confirm identical results
  * Keyboard test: 'a' -> select dir -> Enter -> navigate 10 issues -> 's' -> 'q'
- Under 800 lines total: main(), parse_html(), audit_file(), curses_ui(), json persistence
- Exit codes: 0=success, 1=audit found issues, 2=invalid input
